reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time here. It was surprise to drive up the narrow road to this little slice of paradise. We stayed in "the house". It had two bedrooms, a kitchen and a bathroom. Everything was perfect, the rooms, the decor, the beds. We had all the dishes, glasses and everything we could want. There is a little book in the room giving you all the info you need. No TV! No phone! lovely.
reviews.title: Wow! loved it here. Paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast did not come with the room, it was extra. It was inexpensive and AMAZING. I kid you not, ginger-pumpkin salsa! I don't know what it was for but I put it in my yogurt and on bread. wow! There were three other kinds of salsa and I never got to them. They had eggs to orders, pinto gallo, cheeses, and the breads here were homemade! wonderful!
reviews.title: Super base for Monteverde

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The office is a short walk from the rooms and there you can find a helpful staff, free internet, seating and a library. The staff here was super great, patient with our many questions, concerns and needs.
reviews.title: A wonderful Stay in Cabin #1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a couple of dogs and cats on the property. They were very sweet and gentle with our daughter who adores animals. The white dog was lively and played so nicely with her.
reviews.title: Great hotel near Monteverde

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff arranged for a tour of the Monteverde Cloud Forrest for us with a guide named Adrian (sp?). We almost didn't go because it's a pretty long hike (3 hours), it was pouring rain and we thought our 4 year old wouldn't make it. He convinced us it would be fine and we are glad we listened because it was one of the best things we did in Costa Rica. We saw all types of monkeys, bugs, birds, a tarantula, bird nests with babies and even yes!!! the Resplendent Quetzal!!! yes! The guide was well educated and he was great with daughter along. This is an amazing part of the world and having a good guide so added to our appreciation.
reviews.title: A perfect choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were in Monteverde/Santa Elena and loved our stay in the Arco Iris Lodge. We really can't say enough great things about the place. We stayed in the Honeymoon suite which is the lodge situated on top of the hill. First our lodge was amazing. It was 3 floors, 1st floor was the kitchen which had everything you needed to eat in. The 2nd floor was the bathroom and whirlpool in which you could sit and watch the sideways rain. Also on that floor was the deck where my wife and I ate our breakfast in perfect view of what we called our morning rainbow. They make grow their own food, their breakfast is amazing and on occasion while eating breakfast you will be greeted by some Capuchin monkeys outside the window. The staff is so helpful. We had an issue with our schedule with interbus and after several calls by them totally took care of it last minute. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Amazing Place To Stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Arco Iris Lodge for two nights in March 2009. The inn is located on a side street up on a hill away from downtown Santa Elena. The hotel receptionist was very friendly and booked us on a guided tour of Santa Elena Reserve and 100% Adventura suspension bridges. Our cabin was clean and cozy, but the bed was too firm. The shower was great and there was plenty of hot water. We walked 5 minutes into downtown Santa Elena for dinner and breakfast. One morning, we paid $7 per person for breakfast, but agree with other reviewers that the price is too high. In the reception area there is a binder with all of the menus from the local restaurants. I would recommend that you make a reservation if you plan to stay here during the high season. When we were in the reception area, a few customers stopped by to look for rooms, but there was no vacancy.
reviews.title: Great location in Monteverde

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, fill up with fuel before driving to the Monteverde area. After our 2 nights at Arco Iris we drove to Arenal Volcano via Talaran. The road is unpaved with lots of potholes and bumps. We had a 4-wheel drive vehicle, but 4-wheel drive was not necessary. The extra clearance was helpful, but not essential. Just drive slow and pull to the side to let speedy cars pass. The drive is beautiful with rolling hills and pastures. Allow about 3 to 4 hours for the trip from Arco Iris to Arenal Volcano N.P. We would stay at Arco Iris again.
reviews.title: Basic hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Arco Iris one night, Room 6 on top floor. Pd $7 for adequate breakfast. Room was very basic. Bed extremely firm. No TV or amenities, but didn't go to Costa Rica to watch TV either. No a/c but it was not needed (cool and breezy weather). Ants visited room during the night. Very friendly staff and hotel located near center of town. Did get some road noise from main street. We pd cash $70/night. $75 if you paid with credit card.
reviews.title: Get the Honeymoon Cabin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I picked the Arco Iris at the last minute after other accomodations fell through. We chose the Honeymoon Cabin and were very pleased with our choice.
reviews.title: Good location, Good advice from Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: We stayed at the Arco Iris Lodge for 2 nights in January 2009. We enjoyed the lodge a lot, we had small but lovely cabin up the hill. Bed was not super comfortable, but the cabin was very nice and clean, the bathroom was great, and we had a nice baklcony with comfortable chairs outside. Since there is a lodge, don't expect a mini bar and a TV but we did not expect that. We enjoyed the wildlife around the hotel: we saw toucanets and nice birds, as well as a big toucan and monkeys every morning around the restaurant. There is a restaurant for the breakfasts, which are not included but for a reasonable price you get a nice breakfast buffet with a good choice and a free monkey show.. The hotel is very well situated, a very short walk to the center of Santa Elena.
reviews.title: Loved the Arco Iris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would certainly recommend this hotel, very good quality for the price..
reviews.title: Great stay at the Iris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Arco Iris. Rooms were neat and clean. Staff was very helpful and had great recommendations. All tours set up through this hotel were great. WiFi internet access was available in the lobby.
reviews.title: Worst experience of our Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good. White faced monkeys would come each morning and sit outside the breakfast windows. We were also able to see many birds and a tuacan while here.
reviews.title: Delightful and cozy inn at the heart of the Monteverde region

likes.liked: — The privacy and the cute honeymoon cabin
likes.disliked: — The mattress was a bit firm for our liking, but not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: We also set up transportation through this hotel. Our driver was fabulous. Everyone speaks great english which was quite helpful, due to my broken spanish. Would definately recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great place in beautiful setting

likes.liked: — The monkeys and toucans in the garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a beautiful sight to see after a long trip & horseback ride to Monteverde. The grounds were lovely. We stayed for 2 nights in the honeymoon cabin & were so pleased. I was a little worried that it didn't have air but due to the climate there it wasn't needed. Check in was so easy & the staff were very friendly & helpful. We didn't have a long stay there so the staff helped us plan what to do to make the best of our stay. We weren't looking forward to Monteverde because everyone said it was cold & rainy. Actually the days we were there were beautiful & warm & we fell in love with this little town. We realized that we had left our camera in our transport vehicle & the staff quickly called the company & got it returned.
reviews.title: Lovely Retreat that Feels like Home

likes.liked: — wonderful staff, great location, & the resident animals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were shown to our cabin & it was super clean & cozy. The kitchen was very nice even though we didn't cook while we were there. Using the jacuzzi on the 2nd floor was very nice & relaxing & the bedroom was nice as well. We used the dvd player one night as well & the wireless internet in the reception area was a plus. If you need laundry done, they also provide that service at a very reasonable price & after traveling for 2 weeks we took advantage of that.
reviews.title: Alpine retreat - in Latin America?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were glad that food & attractions were within walking distance of the lodge so we didn't have to get a taxi but once.
reviews.title: Great hotel, even better staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try the icecream place they recommend..it's delicious. We also enjoyed eating at the Treehouse!! The town seemed very safe & we also walked to the Frogpond & learned a lot there. We went ziplining & did the hanging bridges as well.
reviews.title: A nice getaway

likes.disliked: — Could hear some noise from a road nearby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: I missed my animals at home so the 2 resident dogs & cats kept me good company. The little cat cried outside our window the first night & the dogs came up & played on our porch & in the yard with us. Also the monkeys were outside the breakfast area each morning & that made my stay complete because I am a monkey lover.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations

likes.liked: — Location and rustic charm with comfort
